title: Penrose Limits, Worldvolume Fluxes and Supersymmetry
abstract: It is noted that a finite Penrose limit for brane probes with non-zero worldvolume fluxes does not generically exist; this is closely related to the observation by Blau et al that for a brane probe the Penrose limit is equivalent to an infinite-tension limit. It is shown that when the limit exists, however, the number of supersymmetries preserved by the probe does not decrease.
